The first snowboard was invented in 1965 by Sherman Poppen and was called the "Snurfer". The Snurfer was a combination of two skis strapped together and was used for recreational sliding down snow-covered hills.

The modern snowboard was invented in 1965 by Sherman Poppen, an engineer from Muskegon, Michigan, who created a toy for his daughters by fastening two skis together and attaching a rope to one end so he would have some control as they stood on the board and glided downhill.
